title: [BUG] Stochastic failure while building `grpcio`'s wheel in mac-based runners
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
This bug was first seen when checks in #3820 unexpectedly failed for no obvious reason. `grpcio` is a dependency which is installed during `Install sktime and dependencies` step for every runner. [Link](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/actions/runs/3528908968/jobs/5919567469) to the failing job.

While I don't know why this happening, I want to point out that the reason it is only failing for mac runners is that in the case of [Windows](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/actions/runs/3528908968/jobs/5919567760#step:8:261)/[Ubuntu](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/actions/runs/3528908968/jobs/5919567408#step:5:305) runners, `grpcio` is directly being downloaded as a wheel whereas it is being downloaded as a `.tar.gz` in [mac](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/actions/runs/3528908968/jobs/5919567469#step:5:273)

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->
It is not yet known how to reproduce this. The reason I say this is stochastic is that the subsequent checks are [passing](https://github.com/sktime/sktime/actions/runs/3528908968).

<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->
